properties.name: 77 Bus Stop and Psychic
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingsomerville, MA

properties.name: A Beautiful Anomaly
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  This is my favorite sight on the path. This run-down abandoned dog house and... whatever the heck that plywood structure with the little windowe cut out the top is supposed to be... reminds me of Iowa. This back yard is a beautiful anomaly.

properties.name: A Well-Loved St Christopher
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Alibrandi's Barber Shop
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 194 holland st, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Bridge Over the Alewife Brook
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Cross the bridge over Alewife Brook to get to the Path entrance or to get to the Alewife Brook Parkway crosswalk over to Somerville.

properties.name: Buddha was in Louis da Pimp
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing cryptic sidewalk scrawl

properties.name: DIY Turtle Stump Carving
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Smells Lovely

properties.name: Davis Red Line T, South Entrance
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingDavis Square, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Demolished House Being Rebuilt
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  This run-down ugly old house was on sale for a long time. Then it was sold, and now they\'ve torn it down almost completely and are rebuilding it. I wonder why they bother keeping the front wall.

properties.name: Diesel
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   The Diesel is huge, but even so it can be hard to find a place to sit on the weekend. Go all the way to the back for the cozy kntialicious sofa spots. Their tea service is a bit lacking (no teapots, only glasses). They have a pool table, booths, a counter with stools, little round tables. It\'s a wonderful place to sit and watch snow fall. Wireless internet costs about a day. They have a photo booth.

properties.name: Johnny's Foodmaster
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  105 Alewife Brook Parkway, Somerville, MA, 02144This is the local supermarket. All of the produce comes from Dole, even the organic stuff. I never buy produce here. But I do shop here for the staples of eggs, butter, milk, and water. I like the local teens working the registers. When you check out, a bagger has to take your groceries out to your car and bring the cart back in. They don\'t let you do it yourself because the parking lot is on a hill leading directly into the Alewife Brook parkway and if you leave a cart out there it\'s going straight into traffic. They have good French cookies here. I also like the frosting-filled scones from the bakery. Reminds me of my childhood. This is the worst place to go if you need a quick something to take with you on the airplane. They\'ve got a lot of junk food and no deli to speak of. Also a very poor source of cheese, though they have hummus covered.

properties.name: La Chic Boutique
properties.description: Posted by Lachic  235 Elm St

properties.name: Little Joe's Coffee Shop
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  You can get an egg sandwich and a fresh coffee here super cheap. It also has a terrace. It\'s dingy, but the guy who runs the place is super nice.

properties.name: Little Parking Lot Here
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Lurking Bug-Eyed Giant Turtle
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  It\'s always fun to peer into other people\'s back yards.

properties.name: Magpie
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  This is the shop run by the same people who do Craftster.org and the Bizarre Bazaar. They sell fantastic crafty crafts. It\'s a couple blocks off Davis, but worth the detour. Go there. Buy things. Be amazed.

properties.name: Mailbox
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThis is the closest mailbox.

properties.name: Most Beautiful Peonies in Town
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: New Delhi Market
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1305 Broadway, Somerville, MAThis little corner store opened up not too long ago, in 2006. They have a great supply of rice, lentils, and beans, plus clarified butter, frozen nan, chutney galore, and crazy subcontinental snacks. Check the fridge for okra! They also rent out and sell a fair selection of your favorite Bollywood movies as well as Indian music. The must-try of this place is the homemade samosa with onion chutney. I wish they had a little more in the way of homemade snacks, but I\'m grateful at the same time for the samosa I can get! The people who run the store are very friendly and chatty. It\'s an all-around fun place to go.

properties.name: New Hummer on the Block
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishinga rare sight in this neck of the woods

properties.name: Nice Place for Fetch
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing This is a nice place to throw a ball for your dog in the evening. There\'s a big hill and the dogs really get a workout. Bring your own plastic bags for doggy doo.

properties.name: No Permit Needed for Parking
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingYou can usually find a spot here. Good to know if you have a party and many of your guests come from outside Somerville.

properties.name: No Permit Needed for Parking
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: No Permit Needed for Parking
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Off-Leash Dog Area
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Somerville dogs run free behind the church next to Matignon HS and L\'ecole bilingue. Watch for poop around the edges!

properties.name: Office of Traffic and Parking
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing133 Holland St, Somerville, MAThis is where you go for * parking permits * guest passes * guest pass extensions * permits for blocking parking when you move * paying tickets There\'s sometimes a line, but the people who work here are pretty reasonably friendly. No robots.

properties.name: Open Gate Shortcut
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingthere\'s an open gate here for cutting through the high school parking lot.

properties.name: Path Intersects with Mass Ave in Arlington
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingsomerville, MAThis is the spot where you can enter and exit the path on Mass Ave in Arlington. Cross Mass Ave to pick up the path on the other side, or head NW up Mass Ave to go check out Arlington.

properties.name: Path Opening
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing This opening leads into the path toward mass Ave, or coming the other direction, it leads to a continuation of the path, but a lot more overgrown and adventurous-feeling. There\'s a nice newly-redone playground right next to the cemetary. The cemetary is great for kiddie biking. Wide paved paths and no cars.

properties.name: Peggy + Sarge are Spies
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing This is written in three-foot-high letters in the school parking lot. I\'m sure someone, somewhere knows what it means.

properties.name: Permit Parking, never a problem finding a spot
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingI\'ve never had a problem finding a parking spot on Waterhouse. Permit only and the city really enforces that. If you have a friend over who doesn\'t have a Somerville Permit, be sure to put your guest pass in there. We\'ve also been ticketed for having visitors use the passes too many days in a row. You can get an extended pass easily from the Traffic Office on Highland. Otherwise, there is also free, permit-free parking on Endicott.

properties.name: Poor Little Rich Girl
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   416 Highland Avenue, Somerville, MA, 02144Poor Little Rich Girl. 617-684-0157. This is a small shop, but with lots of quality stuff. It\'s pricier than Goodwill, but you don\'t have to dig.

properties.name: Rosebud Diner
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 381 Summer St, Somerville, MAThe Rosebud isn\'t necessarily a great place to knit, but one of the waitresses there is an avid knitter and it is fun to sit at the bar and talk to her and check out her latest projects. Last time I saw her, she was making a little side money knitting custom scarves for really cheap for some of the regular customers.

properties.name: Sacco's Bowl Haven
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    45 Day St., somerville, MANothing like getting together with your gaggle on a Wednesday night for some knitting an bowling. Gossip, knit, watch the oldsters lob in the league lanes, throw things, play some Sinatra on the juke box... candlepin bowling has three throws per person per turn. Plenty of knitting time between frames.

properties.name: Sad Bike Drowning
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    Look over the side of the bridge toward Mass Ave to see the sad bike stuck in the brook. It\'s a kids bike and has been there a long time. There\'s another bike which is visible when the water is low.

properties.name: Scary Ghetto Hanging Cable
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingwaterhouse st, somerville, MAOne day I noticed that there was a really long loose wire hanging off this telephone pole. It looked a little scary. One of the neighbors made a few calls and found out that the wire belonged to rcn, the cable company. He called to ask them to do something about it. Nothing happened for about three months. Then, one day, a truck came from the cable company. I saw it out my window and thought, "Oh good. They\'re going to finally get rid of that wire." The cable guy was out there for over an hour, toiling away. When I went out later, I looked at his handiwork. He had wrapped some black electrical tape around part of the wire, tucked another part of the wire behind something attached to the pole, and coiled the wire up under a cinderblock on the sidewalk. Nice job.

properties.name: Sledding Hill
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   There\'s as nice little hill behind the Matignon high school. It leads down onto the back end of the school\'s parking lot. It\'s not a very big hill, but there is one sweet spot where you get a little ramp effect and you can catch some air.

properties.name: Smallest House in Somerville
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing It\'s a tiny blue shed, but somebody lives in it. It even has a basement. A bleeding heart bush grows next to the front steps and the back garden is a wonder.

properties.name: Soleil Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Cozy cafe on the corner at Teale Square. They have a decent selection of teas. The food is good. The sunshine streaming in through the big windows is divine. The only problem is that they close at 4PM and on Sundays.

properties.name: Spark Craft Studio
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Spark fills many crafty needs, but their knitting stuff is on the lower level. They have a few books and magazines, a limited range of needles, and lovely high-end (expensive) yarns. They have a drop-in crafting membership which I\'ve never tried, but my knitting gang had a really fun time one night hanging out there knitting as a free trial. The renovation of the building is totally beautiful. They sell some local designers\' wares. They have TONS of scrapbooking stuff.

properties.name: St. Christopher, a bit bug-eyed
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 208 Holland St, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Strong Bad Car
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing I saw this Strong Bad car on my way to Davis Square.

properties.name: T Stop North Entrance, Red Line
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingDavis Square, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Teale Square Auto
properties.description: Posted by IdeabuzzBroadway & Victoria St, Somerville, MAI use this gas station for several reasons. The main reason is that it is the closest one to my house and I am a total sucker for convenience. The gas is usually a couple cents cheaper than the other local places. It\'s a full service gas station and the people who work here always seem to be in a good mood, which I think is a sign of good management.They also have a car repair garage here, but i have been fortunate not have had an opportunity to try it out. I did buy cigarettes here late one night and was impressed by their display of post cards and holiday greetings from loyal customers. Generally, the place gives off a great vibe. No frills.Lines can be a drag in the rush hours.Full service.

properties.name: WaterHouse
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Who
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingis it the principal\'s?This boat is parked behind the high school. Who gets to park a boat here?
